intro: Psiadia minor, commonly known as the lesser psiadia, is a small flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its flowers are small and yellow, often appearing in clusters, and it produces small, oval-shaped fruits. Psiadia minor is often found in dry, open habitats and is considered a low-growing perennial species.
